result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adolfo Jr Castro Jr

records.addlTxt: Scheduling conference on November 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

2:08 PM Defendant Adolfo Jr Castro Jr appeared by video.  Attorney Jacalyn Christie Labre appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Larry J. Lloyd appeared by video for Adolfo Jr Castro Jr.   State is withdrawing its offer and will not offer it again.  Defendant wishes to have a preliminary examination.  Detective Schultz of the Manitowoc Police Department / Drug Enforcement Unit is sworn in and testifies.  State begins examination at 2:10 p.m.  Attorney Lloyd begins his cross examination at 2:17 p.m.  Parties rest.  Witness is dismissed.  State requests bindover.  Defense requests dismissal.  Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed in Manitowoc County and binds the Defendant over for further proceedings.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information has been filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Offer deadline:  September 9, 2022.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on August 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

3:36 pm - Prosecuting attorney Jill L. Vendetti in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Adolfo Jr Castro Jr in court. Public defender has not appointed counsel in this matter yet.  The defendant wishes to wait for public defender to appoint.  Court finds good cause to toll time limits.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Report from Public Defender indicating no attorney has been appointed yet.

Prosecuting attorney Marconi De Franca Barros appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Adolfo Jr Castro Jr appeared by video. 
Public defender needs more time to appoint counsel.  Defendant waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.  Court tolls time limits. 
Preliminary hearing reset to 06-17-2022 at 3:00pm.
Report from Public Defender indicating no attorney has been appointed yet.

Order to Withdraw.  
The Court hereby orders that Atty. Luke Harrison is allowed to withdraw as attorney of record in this case.
Letter to Judge Dietz Waiving Time Limits
Preliminary hearing on May 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 03-10-22 at 11:00 a.m.    
Minutes.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of misdemeanor bail jumping, possess fentanyl, possess drug paraphernalia, possess methamphetamine with intent to deliver and possess narcotic I,II.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 02-28-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $5,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release and defendant must maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
